result.execSummary:
The defendant James A Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Participate in and successfully complete Treatment Court in Jackson County. Any other condition determined to be appropriate by probation agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
10:57 AM Cases 22CF96, 22TR516, 22TR517, 22TR518 and 22TR531 called at this time - appearances stated. 

Defendant James A Jones in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven G. Richards (in 22CF96 only) in court for James A Jones.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin.
 
Atty Richards states there is an agreement - Def. will plead No contest to single count in 22CF96, parties agree to 3 yrs. probation, Imposed and stayed sentence - 18 mos. initial confinement, 24 mos. ext. supervision.  State will request conditional jail of 30 days, and successful completion of Treatment Court as alternative to revocation in Jackson Co. case.

Atty. Steiner agrees with that recitation - states def. will also plead to 22TR518 and state will move to dismiss the balance of TR cases
Court clarifies agreement -Parties agree that completion of Treatment Court is a condition of probation but Defense free to argue other conditions/conditional jail

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the constitutional and fundamental rights with Defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the elements of the charge with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the minimum / maximum penalties with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 

11:07 AM -  Court asks defendant for plea. Defendant enters a plea. 
as to 22CF96:   Def. enters plea of NO CONTEST
Court accepts the defendants plea and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters plea. Court finds the defendant GUILTY. 

as to 22TR518: Def. enters plea of NO CONTEST
Court accepts the defendants plea and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters plea. Court finds the defendant GUILTY.  PAC .182

Court sentences def on case 22TR518
$250.00 forf plus court costs and surcharges, $120. blood draw ($1057.50 total) , 6 mos. DL rev., Alcohol Assessment & DSP, IID for 1 yr - 60 DTP (def. can request a payment plan)

AS TO  22CF96

11:11 AM  - Atty Steiner is heard on sentence- requests maximum penalty imposed and stayed sentence, Treatment Court appropriate, 30 days conditional jail. 
Court inquires as to sentence credit - counsel agree to 110 days jail credit 

11:15 AM - Atty. Richards is heard on sentence - Treatment court as an alternative to revocation is best chance for success. Requests court not impose 30 days conditional jail - follow recommendations otherwise  

Comments by Defendant

11:23 Court is heard on sentence - will not impose any conditional jail,  3.5 yrs prison, 18 months initial confinement, 24 months extended supervision, imposed and stayed , 3 years probation, conditions of probation - def. must participate in and successfully complete Treatment Court in Jackson Co. and any other conditions as determined to be appropriate by probation agent. Court costs of $518.00 - 60 DTP or request payment plan. 110 days jail credit if revoked. Consecutive to any other sentence. ($1575.50 total)

9:52 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant James A Jones appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for James A Jones.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Richards is heard.  Requests a plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:19 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant James A Jones appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for James A Jones.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF96 along with 2022TR000516, 2022TR000517, 2022TR000518, 2022TR000531
Attorney Richards is heard and waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count. 

Defendant also plead NG is each of the traffic matters. 

Attorney Steiner is heard on the refusal case. Requests that the refusal matter follow along with the rest of the cases.
Jury status hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury status hearing on September 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:00 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant James A Jones appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for James A Jones.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

State calls first witness. 

1W - M. Ploessl, sworn. 
Exam by Atty Steiner
Cross by Atty Richards

State is heard. State requests matter to be bound over for further proceedings. 
Atty Richards is heard. 

Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 

Atty Richards requests an separate date for arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

9:33 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant James A Jones appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney S. Richards appears via video for the defendant. Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Along with 2022TR000516, 2022TR000517, 2022TR000518, 2022TR000531

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:41 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant James Alan Jones appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty. Steiner states no complaint prepared, does intend to file. Requests this matter be set for an initial appearance in a day or two and continue bond.

comments by Defendant re: revocation - confused why attorney is not present in this case

Complaint must be filed by 6/23/22 or def. may be released
Hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.

1:18 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant James Alan Jones appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a $1,000.00 cash bond.  Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $500.00 cash bond.  Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
